Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

Digital Filter Services

Discussion

Filter processors are external plug-ins that can manipulate digital sample data. Common filter processors include equalizers, low or high-pass filters, and reverb filters. Under Windows, filter processors themselves are simply Win32 DLLs that have the "FLT" file extension. Under MacOS, filter processors are shared libraries. At startup time, MSS loads any filters found in the same directory as the MSS32.DLL file (or a directory specified by AIL_set_redist_directory).

Note that filter support is available only with the Win32 and MacOS version of Miles. The Xbox has dedicated hardware for DSP filtering that can be used with Miles - see the Xbox docs for details.

Miles currently includes sixteen different filters. They include: capture, high-pass, band-pass, parametric equalizer, shelving equalizer, mono delay, stereo delay, resonator, phaser, chorus, flange, ring/amplitude modulator, auto-panner, compressor, volume ramper, and a Lagrangian interpolator. Miles also includes low-pass and high-quality reverb built right into our mixer.

As with all of Miles, we include full source code for all of the filters (see the \src\sdk directory).

By default, filter processors are not installed on any digital driver. To install a filter processor to be the default filter processor for a digital driver, use the AIL_set_digital_driver_processor function. To install a filter processor for a specific sample, use the AIL_set_sample_processor function. Each individual sample can only have one sample processor installed on it at one time. If you need to stack multiple filters on one sample, then you need to use a filter that can call a series of other filters. Each digital driver can support one filters for each sample, though (you could have a compressor filter on one sample and a low-pass filter on another sample).

Filter processors can contain both filter-level and sample-level settings. A filter-level setting might be the amount of memory it should use. A sample-level setting might be the mix level to use for that sample. As with all RIB-based plug-ins, you read the settings with "attributes" and you change the settings with "preferences".

Digital Filter Services
AIL_set_redist_directory sets the location of your application's Miles directory.
AIL_find_filter tries to locate a filter by it's name.
AIL_enumerate_filters enumerates the available filter processors for display or for opening.
AIL_open_filter opens a filter to prepare it for use.
AIL_close_filter closes a previously opened filter.
AIL_set_sample_processor assigns the filter or mixer stages for a specific sample.
SAMPLESTAGE describes the stage in the sample pipeline to install the filter on.
AIL_set_stream_processor assigns the filter or mixer stages for a specific stream.
AIL_set_DLS_processor assigns the filter or mixer stages for a specific sample.
AIL_set_digital_driver_processor assigns the filter or mixer stages for a digital driver.
DIGDRVSTAGE describes the stage in the driver pipeline to install the filter on.
AIL_enumerate_filter_attributes enumerates through the possible filter-level attributes and preferences.
RIB_INTERFACE_ENTRY specifies a structure that contains RIB attribute and/or preference information.
RIB_ENTRY_TYPE describes the type of the RIB entry.
RIB_DATA_SUBTYPE describes the variable type of the RIB entry.
AIL_enumerate_filter_sample_attributes enumerates through the possible sample-level filter attributes and preferences.
AIL_filter_attribute retrieves the current value of the specified filter-level attribute.
AIL_filter_sample_attribute retrieves the current value of the specified sample-level attribute.
AIL_filter_stream_attribute retrieves the current value of the specified sample-level attribute.
AIL_filter_DLS_attribute retrieves the current value of the specified sample-level attribute.
AIL_set_filter_preference sets the value of the specified filter-level preference.
AIL_set_filter_sample_preference sets the value of the specified sample-level preference.
AIL_set_filter_stream_preference sets the value of the specified sample-level preference.
AIL_set_filter_DLS_preference sets the value of the specified sample-level preference.
